TopicTitle: Custom Control Pad + Sneak Peek video

Articles.Content:
Well lets step through my first impressions.

The control pad does a very good job of making it feel like you are using a control pad for your spaceship. I have only used it on my iPad mini and it is quite functional.

So I will now run through my pros, cons, and suggestions. Keeping in mind there are still bug fixes and touch how being released to beta testers in the next few days.

PROS:

1) Looks like and actual console

2) Displays useful information via LCD like the Celestial Body Info, Orbit info, and Vessel Info

3) The ability to rearrange the panel to whatever configuration you want

4) The ability exists to send info to the program from other Mods and Plugins should the developers wish to do that(MecJeb2, ORDA, KAS and Kerbal Engineer instantly sprung to mind for me)

4) Nice touches of things like save buttons, map, view and other UI buttons

Cons:

1) Apparently no volume control for the button presses so that is a little annoying.

2) Having to reconnect to the control pad at every launch is a bit annoying as well, it would be nice if it remembered the port number for each session of KSP that you play so you aren't having to type it in each time(I launch crash, launch crash, so this is frequent for me)

3) Controls don't appears responsive enough for me to trust flying with it BUT I do love using it for information and button clicks which is where it would excel for other plugins to run off of, like MechJeb

Suggestions:

1) Other Mod developers should definitely take a look at this, it makes the KSP experience more immersive and because you can customize it the options are endless

2) Few more settings like volume control

3) Make the port saved for the session if possible

ONce a bluetooth connection is established , CCP will use that ! (meaning SUPER responsiveness, as if was a PS3 joystick). If it doesn't, email me beacouse its a bug we will have to handle it.

- We are working on volume control bug

- Permanent connection in KSP will come, not hard , just have to find some time to dedicate to KSP mod.

More info soon...

L.J. Being that I'm also a musician I was curious about your OP stating midi. What are you using to translate the communication especially midi?

L.J. Being that I'm also a musician I was curious about your OP stating midi. What are you using to translate the communication especially midi?

We are creating a virtual device (with driver) on the PC /Mac and send input from ipad (or to ipad) through that, if the application listend for midi channels it will be able to listen do input form CCP (with all midi benefits). We are still working out some issues on midi and joystick drivers (many OS versions, crashes, and mostly a way to configure midi channel data), so MIDI and Joystick wont make it into version one, BUT they will be among the "stars" of version 1.1 wich will be released shortly after. More info on it will be available after v.1.0 release. (in the meantime if you have any preferences, requests or suggestions regarding midi, let me know more than happy to listen to them).
